alert.note: Alert for Laurel; McCreary; Pulaski; Rockcastle; Wayne; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 8:20PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Wayne, western Laurel, Pulaski, McCreary, southern Rockcastle and western Whitley Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 820 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Science Hill to near Sunnybrook. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Science Hill, Dabney, Bobtown and Ruth around 825 PM EDT. Valley Oak, Shopville, Woodstock, Great Meadows Campsites and Bent around 830 PM EDT. Griffin, Rockeybranch, Bloss, Coopersville, Barrier and Oil Valley around 835 PM EDT. Slavens, Kidds Crossing, Hansford, Pongo, Luner, Co-Operative, Ritner, Denney, Billows and Gregory around 840 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Camp Wildcat, Hazel Patch, Wood Creek Lake, Blue Heron, Whitley City, Wiborg, Mershons, Marshes Siding, Parkers Lake, Stearns, Hare, Pine Knot, Beulah Heights, Victory, Greenwood, Cumberland Falls S.P., Honeybee, Youngs Creek, Krupp, Bark Camp, Duckrun and Huxley. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 43 and 53. Kentucky Highway 80 in Laurel County between mile markers 1 and 10. Kentucky Highway 80 in Pulaski County between mile markers 17 and 40. Louis B. Nunn Parkway MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for south central Kentucky.

area.areaDesc: Laurel; McCreary; Pulaski; Rockcastle; Wayne; Whitley
